huntBios.GENERAL_INFORMATION: This unit is a General Season hunt unit and is not managed to be a trophy unit but every year a few really nice bucks are taken.  Fifty percent of the deer habitat is public land, but hunters should be aware of the private lands and learn the boundaries.  Large blocks of the best deer habitat on this unit are private lands.
huntBios.WEATHER_CONS: The weather on this hunt unit can vary dramatically during the hunting season.  Be prepared for rain, lightening, snow, wind and heat.  Early fall snow storms occur regularly in this area during this hunt.  Most years the snow will melt off within a day or two.  Be prepared for dry or muddy conditions.
huntBios.MANAGEMENT_OBJ: 36.9~19000~14850~18–20~18.5~~~~~~~~For more detailed information on population and objective data please see the Big Game Annual Report Page.
huntBios.BIOLOGIST_NOTES:
Migration Patterns: Many of the deer on this unit migrate down in elevation beginning in the second or third week of October. Dry or wet conditions will dictate where you can find deer during the hunting seasons.


Mule Deer rut: The mule deer rut usually runs from mid Nov.-mid Dec. so it does not affect this hunt. On years with cooler weather some of the larger bucks will start into some pre rut behavior.


Recommended areas to hunt: The Zion Unit has a healthy deer population. Deer densities are high in good deer habitat. Expect to see several bucks each day. To increase your chances of seeing deer it is best to find water in good deer habitat. During the archery hunt most deer are still in their summer habitat. Most deer will be at the middle to higher elevations from oak brush to the aspen and mixed conifer zone. About 59% of deer summer habitat on the Zion unit is on private lands. The northern portions of the unit south of Highway 14 are the best places for public access onto Forest Service land.
Some good areas to hunt are the following:
Webster’s Flat and Deep Creek – Forest Service land From Woods Ranch area in Cedar Canyon to just east of the Zion Overlook. The Deep Creek area is a USFS roadless area. Access can be found at the trail head a short distance above the turn off to Webster’s Flat on Highway 14.
Midway – USFS land from the turn off to Cedar Breaks east to Navajo Lake. The old clear cut logging areas and meadows in the Deer Valley area usually have a fair amount of deer use.
Strawberry Ridge and Harris Flat- USFS land between Strawberry Cabins area and east to Stout Canyon. This is a ponderosa pine are that has a good understory of bitterbrush. There is good access in to this area with several OHV trails and old logging roads. This area has several wildlife and livestock water catch ponds. This area has several cabin communities and hunters should be careful of private lands and how close they hunt to cabins.
Stout Canyon and School Wash – USFS land with some larger blocks of private land. This is a ponderosa pine habitat with a good understory of bitterbrush. There are a few OHV trails and logging roads that cut through this area.
Private land - Some of the best deer habitat on the Zion unit is on private lands. This unit is unusual for Southern Utah because of its large parcels of private lands that have several different land owners. Obtaining permission to hunt these areas can be difficult, but is not impossible.

huntMaster.NOTES:
Baiting big game for the purposes of hunting is now illegal in Utah.
Click here for more information.

The use of all trail cameras (including both non-handheld transmitting and non-transmitting devices) in the harvest or to aid in the harvest of big game is prohibited between July 31 and Dec. 31. Click here for more information.
huntMaster.HARVEST_REPORTING: Voluntary: The DWR conducts random surveys for all general season hunts. You may be contacted via phone to participate in this survey.

huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: Please direct all questions regarding maps and camping regulations to the Kanab and St George BLM Field Offices.
huntBoundaryInfos.SUGGESTED_MAPS: BLM: Kanab, St George, Cedar City
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS: All roads and ATV trails on this unit are managed by the BLM and SITLA and regulations are covered in their Travel Management Plans.  Please direct all questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated on to the Kanab and St George BLM Field Office.
huntBoundaryInfos.PRIV_TRIBE_LAND_ISSUES: This unit is largely private land.  Make sure you have written permission before entering private land.
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Iron, Kane and Washington counties—Boundary begins at the Utah-Arizona state line and I-15; north on I-15 to SR-14; east on SR-14 to US-89; south on US-89 to US-89A; south on US-89A to the Utah-Arizona state line; west on this state line to I-15. This hunt is comprised of all or largely private property. Excludes Zion National Park. EXCLUDES ALL NATIVE AMERICAN TRUST LANDS WITHIN THIS BOUNDARY. Excludes all CWMUs. USGS 1:100,000 Maps: Cedar City, Kanab, Panguitch, Saint George. Boundary questions? Call the Cedar City office, 435-865-6100.
